alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 21 at 4:26AM PST until January 21 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation. Additional ice accumulations of around one half of an inch. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The bulk of the ice accumulation is expected in southern Skamania County near the Columbia River Gorge. Additional ice accumulation on top of already existing snow and ice will further increase the risk of downed trees and powerlines. Travel impacts will continue along portions of I-84 and SR14 as well.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
